hypothesis_content.title: Exchange Outflow Acceleration Contrarian
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC exchange net outflows accelerate to >2x 30-day average during price declines in NEUTRAL/BEAR regimes, it signals accumulation rather than distribution, leading to price stabilization/reversal within 3-7 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Accelerated outflows during price declines suggest strong hands are accumulating at perceived discounts. This removes sell-side liquidity from exchanges, creating upward pressure once buying resumes.
entry_conditions: Price decline of 2-8% during outflow period
Exchange reserves as % of supply dropping (≤30-day low)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price rebounds to pre-outflow levels OR outflow rate normalizes (<1.5x average)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Outflows stop/reverse to inflows while price continues declining >5% from entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Outflows continue for >5 days without price stabilization, indicating potential movement to OTC/private sales rather than cold storage accumulation.
